oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Prussian Model 1809 Musket was converted to percussion some time after 1839. Several thousand Prussian muskets were imported during the war by both sides. Some Prussian muskets were issued to Ohio troops early in the war. Most Prussian muskets are .71 or .72 caliber. The ramrods is a replacement purchased from Dixie Gun Works.
